articles.content: Located within Singaporeâ€™s research hub, CapitaLand Developmentâ€™s 343-unit LyndenWoods development offers residents the chance to walk to work through tree-lined pathways while offering convenient connectivity to lifestyle facilities. Located within the Science Park district, LyndenWoods will be the first residential development launched in this evolving live-work-play neighbourhood. This could be your lifestyle at LyndenWoods, a 343-unit condominium by CapitaLand Development (CapitaLand) that marks the developerâ€™s first residential project within the Science Park precinct. The towers are designed like point blocks, maximising corner views. This configuration ensures privacy while creating a more exclusive living environment with better views and enhanced natural ventilation. As Singapore Science Park transforms into a vibrant district, LyndenWoods presents an attractive investment opportunity for homeowners and investors. articles.title: Fasten your seatbelts: Turbulence ahead for budget carriers in Changi Airport
articles.summary:
ğŸ“° ì‹±ê°€í¬ë¥´, êµí†µ, ê³µí•­ ê´€ë ¨ ë‰´ìŠ¤
ğŸ“¢ Fasten your seatbelts: Turbulence ahead for budget carriers in Changi Airport
articles.content: Full-service carriers are increasingly defending short-haul leisure and Visiting Friends and Relatives (VFR) markets with competitive pricing. Farouk Kamal, deputy chief executive of AirAsia Aviation Group, said at a recent panel discussion that budget travellers have found Singapore becoming expensive, with airport fees and charges sometimes higher than the base fare itself. Jetstar Asiaâ€™s closure certainly thus highlights the rising pressure on airlines to critically evaluate market performance and redeploy limited resources to higher-yielding opportunities. She warns, however, that if budget carriers find themselves unable to maintain profitability in Singaporeâ€™s competitive landscape, further rationalisation or capacity shifts are possible. In a constrained supply environment, airlines are increasingly prioritising markets where they can achieve better margins and scale. â€œI would say most of them will generate a small profit this year.â€
